definition: to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: Hoffenheim were instantly dismissed by many as cannon fodder after their promotion last season.
sentences.chinese: 霍芬海姆上赛季升入甲级伊始就被众球队当做是炮灰。

sentences.english: The treaty obliged themtoprovide cannon -fodder for it.
sentences.chinese: 这项条约迫使他们为它提供炮灰。

sentences.english: All the army wanted you for was cannon fodder .
sentences.chinese: 军队就是要你来当炮灰嘛。

sentences.english: The treaty obliged them to provide cannon-fodder for it.
sentences.chinese: 这项条约迫使他们为它提供炮灰。

sentences.english: Use only with own cannon fodder.
sentences.chinese: 当你有炮灰支援的时候才使用高斯炮。

sentences.english: Finally, it is clear the call operation is called cannon fodder used.
sentences.chinese: 最后的召唤术很明显就是召唤炮灰用的。

sentences.english: In the eyes of warmongers, soldiers are nothing but cannon fodder.
sentences.chinese: 战争贩子们视士兵为炮灰。

sentences.english: If you don't, you get stuck in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 要是你不这样，你就只好到伊拉克去当炮灰了。

sentences.english: They don't really need cannon fodder.
sentences.chinese: 塔利班真的不需要炮灰。

sentences.english: In times of war peasants are forced from their farms and drafted into levies. Good cannon fodder.
sentences.chinese: 农民经常在战时被强行征召入伍，充任廉价炮灰。

sentences.english: The infantry were cannon-fodder in the attack that was bound to fail.
sentences.chinese: 在那场必定要失败的进攻中，步兵成了炮灰。

definition: sb who sacrifices himself/sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable
those on our side/ourselves/one's own people/one of us
to charge and break through enemy lines
lit. straggling and disbanded soldiers (idiom); fig. disorganized uncoordinated action
